meanings.definition: A large number of people gathered together.
meanings.sent1: The crowd cheered loudly at the football game.
meanings.sent2: The crowd at the concert was excited and energetic.
meanings.sent3: The crowd waiting for ice cream was so big, it looked like a colorful sea.
meanings.sent4: The crowd of stars in the night sky twinkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The crowd of colorful balloons filled the sky with joy.

meanings.definition: To press closely together or into a small space.
meanings.sent1: Please do not crowd the doorway, let others pass.
meanings.sent2: The passengers began to crowd into the train as it arrived.
meanings.sent3: The toys in the box seemed to crowd together to make space for the new one.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts in my mind started to crowd out all other distractions.
meanings.sent5: The trees in the forest seemed to crowd together to share the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To fill or occupy to the point of overflowing.
meanings.sent1: The books on the shelf started to crowd each other due to lack of space.
meanings.sent2: The colorful decorations began to crowd the room, making it feel cozy.
meanings.sent3: The toppings on the pizza seemed to crowd together, creating a delicious mess.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the trip started to crowd my mind, making me smile.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden began to crowd each other, creating a beautiful display.
